the Statesman's Laylan Copelin: "State Reps. Tom Craddick and Eddie Rodriguez are a political odd couple united by their legislation that payday lenders say will put them out of business." From the Statesman's Mike Pence Ward: Texans 70 and older would not have to show a photo ID to vote. People without a driver's license could get a free state photo ID card to vote. And people could use their concealed-handgun licenses to vote. Those are among the provisions of a voter ID bill the Gov. Rick Perry Senate approved late Wednesday and sent to the House, where approval also is expected. But both supporters and opponents predicted Thursday that the proposal will be changed some more before it gains final approval. Chapel Hill. Page praised Eric Schmidt , too. " Eric Schmidt has clearly done an outstanding job leading Google Inc. for the last decade. The results speak for themselves," he said. There is no other CEO in the world that could have kept such headstrong founders so deeply involved and still run the business so brilliantly. Eric Schmidt is a tremendous leader and I have learned innumerable lessons from him. His advice and efforts will be invaluable to me as I start in this new role. Google Inc. still has such incredible opportunity-- we are nly at the beginning and I can't wait to get started.
